page.title: 07BIRDS OF PREY (page 4)
page.content: {Osprey} The osprey nests in pine forests near water.The female lays 2 eggs heavily marked with a reddish brown. The male and female both sit on the eggs for 4\ weeks. After six weeks of being fed by both the male and the female the chicks leave the nest. They feed on fish up to 14 pounds of weight from our lochs. { {Barn owl The barn owl often nests in a hollow tree or in a old building on the floor or on the rafters. It has been known to nest on quarry faces.It lays 4-6 white eggs which are sat on by the female for 4\ weeks. The male provides food for the female at the nest site some time before the eggs are laid. There are some to be found in old sheds at Inverernie Lodge.
